class_description:
A NumericShaper.Range represents a Unicode range of a
 script having its own decimal digits. For example, the NumericShaper.Range#THAI range has the Thai digits, THAI DIGIT
 ZERO (U+0E50) to THAI DIGIT NINE (U+0E59). The Range enum replaces the traditional bit
 mask-based values (e.g., NumericShaper#ARABIC), and
 supports more Unicode ranges than the bit mask-based ones. For
 example, the following code using the bit mask:
